utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I so I've just had this pain in my chest for just over a week now and it's caused me to have trouble breathing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um how old are you, Jen?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um 52.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK when did this pain start? You said a week back?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, just about that I I think maybe 8 days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it a constant pain? Is it always there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ahh it it is, but it's definitely worse that um, it's the breathing that's been bothering me a lot more. When I take a deep breath that the pain is a lot worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK um. And when you do get that, get that pain. How long does it last?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I would say, uh. Around 15-20 minutes. It's it goes away over overtime.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the shortness of breath do you have that at rest as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no if I if I take a break or sit down to rest then I can usually catch my breath. But if even if I'm doing a little bit of exertion like walking a few a few blocks or something like that I'm finding it, I'm I'm short of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um do, did anything trigger this a week back? Any trauma to the chest area? Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, No, no one else has been sick. I I had a cough about a week ago so I thought it might be a chest infection, but I'm not feverish, so I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, the cough is it still there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's um. I still have a cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you coughing up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't. I haven't noticed any any blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no sputum.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And do you feel like you're wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no wheezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No wheezing, OK. Um, the shortness of breath 1 to 10, 10 being the worst, the most severe. How bad is your shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say when I'm exerting myself, it could get up to like a 7 or 8.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you mentioned how, how far can you walk before you need to rest.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I would say maybe 100 meters. But before I was able to run uh like I was running a few days per week so. So this is not like me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and the chest pain. Is it sharp or is a dull crampy? What does it feel like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I say it's sharp.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you ever experienced this before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like like this before at all. I I have never had any, any problems like this before?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um, and has it changed since it started a week back or has have your symptoms been pretty much the same?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They've been pretty much the the the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK Um, do you have anything like COPD, Congestive heart failure, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've never had any heart problems, uh in the past. I've been healthy up to this point though, nothing I see a doctor regularly for.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. This you mentioned, no fevers, no chills. And no night sweats too I guess?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, no night sweats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about weight loss? Any weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No weight loss

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Um, have you experienced any changes in your vision?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah no, my visions been been, been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hearing has been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No changes in smell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, um have you had a stuffy nose or runny nose in the past week or so.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's just that the dry cough.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, dry cough. Any changes in your skin like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no rashes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you mentioned some chest pain. Any palpitations like you feel like your hearts racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, actually I did feel like that a little bit. Especially when I was moving a little bit more, I felt like my heart was racing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, any calf pain.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah my left, my left leg's actually a little bit sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any swelling in the area?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: um uh nope, I don't see any swelling there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, no?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, Yeah, we'll say that there is swelling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, OK. And, and you mentioned shortness some shortness of breath on exertion, how about when you're laying down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not when I'm laying down.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, and not when you're OK, not when you're laying down, OK. Um alright and in terms of like your stool, so bowel movements and urination. Like all of that's normal?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, all that's been normal.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: no, no confusion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No confusion.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, No fainting spells.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and have you already received any sort of imaging or pulmonary function tests or anything like that for this recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no. I I I haven't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any past medical history of any conditions really?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, like I've been um previously healthy, but I I guess I did have a hysterectomy a few weeks ago. I know it was, I I didn't bring it up before 'cause it's just a day procedure, but I was definitely spending a lot more time um relaxing at home after that, a few weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, so you haven't been moving around as much. I guess since the hysterectomy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: yeah exactly it's starting to it was starting to get, the pain was starting to improve but it was keeping me on the couch a lot of days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah. Um, are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no I try, I've tried some Tylenol and Advil for the pain throughout this week, and it didn't really help much. But other than that, don't take any any medications, nothing for blood pressure or anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and sorry. What was the hysterectomy for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I I was having a lot of bleeding.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so were they thinking it was like a cancer or something?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I think it was um. It was from Fibroids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK and then,  So you mentioned no medications, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no allergies to medications .

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: no. And are you up to date with any with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I am yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: you are OK. Any family history of lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No lung conditions.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: But how about heart?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's just my mom had a heart attack when she was 56.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. I'm sorry to hear that. And. Any history of family history of something called pulmonary embolism or DVTS.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I haven't heard of a heard of pulmonary embolism before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's basically blood clots in your lung. And then DVT's are deep vein thrombosis. So also blood clots but in different parts of your body.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, anything like that that you know of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I I have might have heard of something like that happening in my mom actually, it might have been related to her heart attack, but I'm not specifically sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sure. Um an then do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I I smoke, I may be about half a pack of cigarettes per day. I've smoked ever since I was a teenager. I've tried to quit multiple times I I was smoking about a pack per day before, so I have cut it down, but still something that I'm working on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK good, I'm glad you're trying to cut down. Um, we have resources available if you're interested in some more help. And you smoke um marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any use of other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about alcohol? Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh may be a glass of wine on the weekends, but other than that no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. I mean, have you had any sick contacts recently? People around you? People you live with at work.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I can't think of any anybody who's been sick no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and and what do you do for work Jenn?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I work as an administrator at at a bank.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. I'm and I have you traveled anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no I I can't remember the last vacation.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, and so those are all the questions that I had for you. Did you have anything that you wanted to add? Anything that I hadn't touched on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um No, I think you covered everything. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, no worries. So I guess at this point we would do a physical exam. Just take a listen to your lungs and your chest. After that, so right now it sounds like it could be something vascular you know, like a pulmonary embolism like we talked about. That's kind of high on my list of things to work up for. But also, we don't want to miss other things you know, like cancer, infection, autoimmune things that could affect your lungs, so we'll just do a work up for all of that. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, whatever, whatever you think we need to do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK sounds good. Thank you for your time.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
